text: The Blip (also known as the Decimation and the Snap) is a term used in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) to describe the event in which half of all life in the universe was erased by Thanos using the Infinity Gauntlet in the film Avengers: Infinity War (2018). This event lasted for five years, and those who were erased were later brought back in the sequel, Avengers: Endgame (2019), through a time heist involving the Avengers. The Blip had significant repercussions on the MCU, affecting characters, communities, and the world as a whole, with various storylines exploring the aftermath and its impact on society.
title: The Blip
